H0.text: Which Shakespeare comedy is set in Messina, Italy. The Tempest

H1.text: Which Shakespeare comedy is set in Messina, Italy. The Two Gentlemen of Verona

H2.text: Which Shakespeare comedy is set in Messina, Italy. The Merchant of Venice

H3.text: Which Shakespeare comedy is set in Messina, Italy. MAAN

A4.text: Messina has provided the setting for two of William Shakespeare's plays, Much Ado About Nothing and The Winter's Tale.

A5.text: Two of William Shakespeare's plays are set in Verona: Romeo and Juliet (which also features Romeo's visit to Mantua) and The Two Gentlemen of Verona.

A6.text: These plays, including Pericles, Prince of Tyre, Cymbeline, The Winter's Tale and The Tempest, are so called because they bear similarities to medieval romance literature.
